com.myronmarston.music
Class Note

java.lang.Object
  com.myronmarston.music.Note
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class Note
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

Represents a note, relative to a particular scale. This note will need to be converted to midi events using the MidiNote class before it can be used in a Midi track.

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Note

public Note()
Default constructor.

Note

public Note(int letterNumber,
            int scaleStep,
            int octave,
            int chromaticAdjustment,
            Fraction duration,
            int volume,
            Scale scale,
            int segmentChromaticAdjustment)
Constructor.

Parameters:
letterNumber - the letter number, relative to the scale
scaleStep - number of scale steps above the tonic; 0 = tonic, 7 = octave, 9 = third an octave above, etc.
octave - which octave the note should be in. 0 begins the first octave in Midi that contains the tonic.
chromaticAdjustment - the number of half steps to adjust from the diatonic note; used if this note is an accidental
duration - how long the note should last, in whole notes
volume - how loud the note should be (0-127)
scale - the scale to use for this note; if this is non-null, it will be used rather than the scale passed to any of this object's methods
segmentChromaticAdjustment - additional chromatic adjustment for a segment of the piece; used to deal with chromatic self-similarity

getSegmentChromaticAdjustment

public int getSegmentChromaticAdjustment()
Gets the chromatic adjustment for a segment of notes. This is used to apply self-similarity to a germ that has chromatic notes.

Returns:
the segment chromatic adjustment

isRest

public boolean isRest()
Gets whether or not this note is a rest (i.e., has a volume of 0).

Returns:
true if the volume is 0

isFirstNoteOfGermCopy

public boolean isFirstNoteOfGermCopy()
Returns true if this is the first note of the germ, or of a derived copy of the germ that may have gone through some transformations.

Returns:
true if this is the first note of a germ copy.

setIsFirstNoteOfGermCopy

public void setIsFirstNoteOfGermCopy(boolean isFirstNoteOfGermCopy)
Sets whether or not this is the first note of a germ or derived copy.

Parameters:
isFirstNoteOfGermCopy - value to set

performTransformerAdjustment

public void performTransformerAdjustment(int scaleStepAdjustment,
                                         int letterNumberAdjustment,
                                         int octaveAdjustment)
Adjusts the scale step, letter number and octave for a transformer. The passed values should be given as deltas, rather than as new values. The letter number will be appropriately adjusted if a scale with less than 7 notes is used so that diatonic notes use the correct letter number.

Parameters:
scaleStepAdjustment - a value to add to the scale step
letterNumberAdjustment - a value to add to the letter number
octaveAdjustment - a value to add to the octave

parseNoteString

public static Note parseNoteString(java.lang.String noteString,
                                   Scale scale,
                                   Fraction defaultDuration,
                                   java.lang.Integer defaultVolume)
                            throws NoteStringParseException
Parses a note string such as F#4,1/8,MF.

Parameters:
noteString - string to parse
scale - the scale to use to determine the scaleStep and chromaticAdjustment
defaultDuration - duration to use if the noteString does not contain a duration
defaultVolume - volume to use if the noteString does not contain a volume
Returns:
a new Note with fields set based on the parsed noteString
Throws:
NoteStringParseException - thrown when the noteString cannot be parsed

getNormalizedNote

public Note getNormalizedNote()
Sometimes after transformations are applied to a note, the scale step is less than 0 or greater than the number of scale steps in an octave. This method "normalizes" the note--adjusts its scaleStep and octave so that it is the same note, but the scaleStep is between 0 and the number of scale steps.

Returns:
the normalized note

convertToMidiNote

public MidiNote convertToMidiNote(Fraction startTime,
                                  int midiTickResolution,
                                  int channel,
                                  boolean keepExactPitch)
Converts the note to a Midi Note, that can then be used to get the actual Midi note on and note off events.

Parameters:
startTime - the time this note should be played
midiTickResolution - the number of ticks per whole note for the midi sequence
channel - the midi channel for this note, 0-15
keepExactPitch - true to keep the exact pitch specified by the note parameters; false to allow the chromaticAdjustment to be changed if it would create a note that is already found in the scale
Returns:
the MidiNote

toNotationNote

public NotationNote toNotationNote(PartSection partSection,
                                   MidiNote midiNote,
                                   Fraction timeLeftInBar)
Converts this Note to a Notation Note that can be used to produce GUIDO or Lilypond notation.

Parameters:
partSection - the Notation partSection
midiNote - the midi note produced as output from this note
timeLeftInBar - the amount of time that is left in the bar
Returns:
the notation note
